headline: Morning News Roundup

headline: Renault Launches Fluence
summary: The French auto maker launched its Fluence sedan in New Delhi. Some snapshots.

headline: Two Years of UPA-II led Government
summary: Since the re-election of the UPA led Government in 2009, the party at the center has seen many ups and downs. Some snapshots of key events.

headline: Europe Debt Concerns Grow
summary: Concerns mounted about Europe's debt problems following a crushing defeat for Spain's ruling party in weekend elections, compounded by infighting in Europe over whether Greek government bonds should be restructured and new warnings from credit-rating agencies.

headline: Making Fast Decisions as  Twister Roars
summary: David Hinkle and a friend in a car made some difficult decisions as the towering Joplin twister bore down on them. "I thought I was going to die," he said. "We were so close."

headline: J&J to Buy JB Chem's Russian brands
summary: Johnson & Johnson's Cilag GmbH International unit has agreed to acquire the over-the-counter brands of India's J.B. Chemicals & Pharmaceuticals for about $260 million.

headline: Court Rejects Telecom Executives' Bail
summary: An Indian court rejected the bail pleas filed by five corporate executives, including three from Reliance Telecom, who were allegedly involved in rigging the sale of telecom licenses in 2008.

headline: Weaker China Activity Spooks Investors
summary: The preliminary HSBC China Manufacturing Purchasing Managers Index, a gauge of nationwide manufacturing activity, fell to a 10-month low of 51.1 in May from a final reading of 51.8 in April, adding to concerns of an economic slowdown in China.

headline: MLB: Everyone Is Alive in AL East and West
summary: Two entire American League divisions are either balanced or mediocre, and Shackleford's Preakness win equals free frozen treats.

headline: U.K. Panel: No Water Risk From 'Fracking'
summary: A U.K. parliamentary committee said it had found no evidence that hydraulic fracturing, the much-debated process used to extract natural gas from dense shale rocks, poses any risk to water supplies and rejected calls for a moratorium on permits for shale-gas activity.

headline: Falun Gong Practitioners Sue Cisco
summary: A group of Chinese Falun Gong practitioners is accusing Cisco Systems in a lawsuit of aiding and abetting torture and other human-rights violations by the Chinese government against members of the religious movement.

headline: Toyota Plans Social Network for Cars
summary: Toyota and Salesforce.com agreed to create a social network that would allow owners of future Toyota electric and plug-in hybrids to connect with each other.

headline: Dow Sinks 130 Points
summary: Stocks plummeted as investors' concerns over the financial health of European governments triggered a flight to safer assets.

headline: New Firms Test Asia's Capacity for Deal Growth
summary: Asia's investment banking scene is getting increasingly crowded as new players go up against established giants—a trend that some bankers grouse could bring down fees.

headline: BofA to Pay $410 Million to Settle Overdraft Suit
summary: More than a million Bank of America customers who overdrew their checking accounts could recoup some overdraft fees following a settlement that received initial approval from a federal judge Monday.

headline: Zvi Goffer, on Tape at Insider Trial, Touts Access to Information
summary: Zvi Goffer used his access to information as a selling point as he tried to recruit a hedge-fund manager to join his start-up trading firm in 2007, according to a recording played at his insider-trading trial on Monday.

headline: Thousands Endure  Rain for Distant Son
summary: U.S. President Barack Obama is just a drop Irish, but that proved more than enough to inspire frenzy here as the president arrived on his first stop on a swing through Europe.

headline: She Shoots, But Will She Score?
summary: Can a trash-talking hockey player with a new spot within the International Olympic Committee help bring the U.S. back into the IOC's good graces and earn her country another chance to host the Games?

headline: Former Fed Official Joins Barclays
summary: The former head of the Federal Reserve's monetary affairs group, Brian Madigan, is joining Barclays Capital as a senior policy adviser, according to an internal memo announcing the hire.

headline: Top CD Yields Fall Below Inflation Rate
summary: Annualized yields on five-year, callable certificates of deposit, or CDs, hit 2.4% in April, while the annual inflation rate hit 3.16%, producing a negative yield of 0.76, according to Market Rates Insight.

headline: Eerie Echoes
summary: QE1 finished at the end of the first quarter in 2010, not long before the market swoon. This year, QE2 is set to finish in June. The real test will be whether the Federal Reserve stands by if market jitters worsen. Recent history suggests the more likely response is to fire up the presses again.

headline: European, Asian Markets Slide
summary: Stock ended sharply lower as worries about euro-zone finances triggered losses for banks and insurers, while travel-related stocks gave ground after a volcanic eruption in Iceland.

headline: Coroner: 'I Don't Know What to Expect'
summary: A temporary morgue was being set up at Missouri Southern State University in Joplin as emergency workers continue to pick through the wreckage of a devastating tornado.

headline: Delta, US Airways Agree to Revised Slot-Swap Plan
summary: Delta Air Lines Inc. and US Airways Group Inc. have agreed to a revised slot-swap plan at two of the country's busiest airports that could see them giving up dozens of takeoff and landing spots if required by regulators.

headline: Dex One, Elbit Imaging: Biggest Price Decliners (DEXO, EMITF)
summary: Markets Data Center: Biggest Price Decliners.

headline: 'Fear Gauge' Climbs 4.8%
summary: The stock market's volatility index rose to its highest level in two months on Monday as investor concern over the worsening European debt crisis carried over to U.S. markets and drove stocks down.

headline: Sequans Communications, Ossen Innovation: Biggest Price Gainers (SQNS, OSN)
summary: Markets Data Center: Biggest Price Gainers.

headline: Brazil's MMX Acquires Control of Sister Firm PortX
summary: Brazilian iron-ore miner MMX Mineracao e Metalicos  acquired control of sister company PortX Operacoes Portuarias SA, allowing it to fully integrate its mining, port and shipping operations and to offer port services to third parties.

headline: Longtop CFO, Auditor Resign; SEC Probes as Stock Halt Goes On
summary: Longtop Financial Technologies, the financial-technology company that last week became the latest Chinese stock to see its U.S.-listed shares halted, said its financial chief and auditor resigned and that the SEC has opened an inquiry.

headline: Europe's Insurers, Airlines Lead Selloff
summary: European markets ended sharply lower as renewed worries about the finances of some euro-zone governments triggered losses for banks and insurers, while travel-related stocks gave ground after a volcanic eruption in Iceland.

headline: Tough Times Stay On the Shop Floor
summary: A reality television star will advise the U.K. government on how to fix floundering town centers. Hard-pressed retailers will take any initiatives to offset the inflation, wage and tax pressures that are keeping consumers away from the shops.

headline: Photos of the Day: May 23
summary: In today's pictures, a U.S. Marine secures a detainee in Afghanistan, a farmer works a rice field in Vietnam, a girl waits as women pray in Yemen and more.

headline: Swaps Group Warns of 'Too Big to Fail' in Clearinghouses
summary: Policy makers should be concerned that derivatives clearinghouses could be the next "too big to fail" beneficiaries of federal bailouts, according to a paper by a swaps group.

headline: Ryanair Warns on Fuel Costs
summary: Ryanair Holdings posted a 23% increase in fiscal-year net profit but warned higher fuel prices will force it to ground twice as many aircraft this winter compared with a year ago.

headline: TNK-BP Says Board Approves $2.13 Billion Quarterly Dividend
summary: The board of TNK-BP Holding, the Russian-listed unit of BP's  Russian joint venture, recommended to pay a fourth-quarter dividend at 59.47 billion rubles ($2.13 billion), the company said Monday, adding that the company will invest most of it in Russia.

headline: Gold Rises On Growth Worries
summary: Comex gold futures settled higher as worries about economic growth in Europe and China sent traders seeking a safe place to park cash, but buying was limited by strength in the dollar.

headline: Crude Drops Below $98 a Barrel
summary: Crude futures ended lower as worries about China's economic growth and the debt situation in Europe put pressure on oil and other risky assets.

headline: Economic Indicators Weigh on Asian Markets
summary: Signs of economic sluggishness in China and renewed European debt woes weighed on Asian markets, raising questions about whether a bigger change in market sentiment is under way.

headline: EBay CEO Still Seeks Acquisitions
summary: EBay could use some of the $2.4 billion it will receive from the sale of its remaining 30% stake in Internet telephony pioneer Skype to make acquisitions and return money to investors through share buybacks.

headline: Ryanair's Drastic Hangar Action
summary: If you can't fly them full, don't fly them at all. Ryanair's drastic-looking plan to ground nearly a third of its aircraft is a prudent move.

headline: Yandex Debates IPO Price Range
summary: Yandex, Russia's most popular search engine, is considering raising the price range for its initial public offering, already worth up to $1.15 billion, amid strong demand from investors.

headline: Commerzbank Shares Fall
summary: Shares in Germany's Commerzbank AG fell 5.3% Monday after the bank set conditions for the second step of its capital increase.

headline: Guilty Plea in Online-Poker Case
summary: A U.S. citizen admitted Monday to helping online-poker companies circumvent laws prohibiting the processing of Internet-gambling payments.

headline: Finra: Jailed Merrill Broker Must Repay Bonus
summary: A broker who went to jail for fraudulently claiming a signing bonus from Bank of America's Merrill Lynch must pay back about $360,000 he still owes the company, an arbitration panel has ruled.

headline: Debt Fears Roil European Markets
summary: European markets crumpled as a toxic mix of bad news over sovereign bonds and slowing economic activity opened up a new chapter in Europe's long-running debt crisis.

headline: Belarus Devalues Belarus Ruble
summary: Belarus's central bank devalued the country's currency by 36%, as it published the new exchange rates on its website.

headline: Citi Hires Ex-CEO of PwC
summary: Samuel Di Piazza Jr., the former chief executive of PricewaterhouseCoopers International, joined the growing group of rainmakers who recently joined Citigroup.

headline: Airline Shares Fall as Ash Fears Grow
summary: Shares of European airlines and travel operators fell as fears grew that the weekend eruption of Iceland's Grimsvotn volcano could lead to widespread disruption like that of April last year.

headline: Luxottica to Take Control of Multiopticas
summary: Italian luxury eyewear company Luxottica said it is buying out Multiopticas Internacional, accelerating its planned expansion into Latin America.

headline: Wal-Mart Tests SalesOf Large Appliances
summary: Wal-Mart, in a test program, is selling large appliances in Texas as it looks for ways to increase revenue in the U.S. An earlier attempt to add large appliances was discontinued.

headline: Obama Begins European Tour
summary: U.S. President Barack Obama opens a four-country, six-day European tour Monday in Ireland, where his largely ceremonial visit will highlight America's deep ties with the Irish.

headline: Thai GDP Growth Accelerates
summary: Thailand's economic growth accelerated in the first quarter from the previous three months, though at a slower pace than market expectations, on the back of healthy domestic demand and surging exports, which continued to hit record highs.

headline: Mizuho Plans to Integrate Units
summary: Mizuho Financial Group said it is considering merging its banking units into a single structure, and that the president of its Mizuho Bank unit is stepping down following a widespread computer-system failure in March.

headline: Euro-Zone Growth Slows to 7-Month Low
summary: Growth in the euro zone's private sector eased more than expected to its weakest pace in seven months in May, led by a sharp slowdown in manufacturing.

headline: European Firms Shun Euro Bonds
summary: European companies have shunned the euro in the bond markets this year and have instead piled into dollar, sterling and even ruble-denominated bonds, data from Dealogic show.

headline: Radioactive Water Treatment Delayed
summary: Japan's construction of a decontamination facility to treat radioactive water is facing a delay, raising new problems of where to store the toxic water and increasing the risk of seawater contamination.

headline: VM Revises Platinum, Palladium Estimates
summary: Strong demand for platinum from the jewelry and industrial sectors will likely result in a smaller-than-expected surplus in 2011, while supply uncertainty and growing demand from autocatalyst makers is expected to push palladium deeper into deficit, VM Group said. ETFs will also be buying platinum-group metals.

headline: Norway Raps Shell for Risking Oil Leak
summary: Royal Dutch Shell has been rapped by Norway's Petroleum Safety Authority for a maintenance error on an oil well that had "major accident potential" and risked an oil leak.

headline: Campbell Earnings Rise But Not Because of Soup
summary: Campbell earnings rose 11%, helped by Goldfish crackers and Pepperidge Farm baked goods. Its namesake soup continues to struggle, though.

headline: China Bank in Talks With TPG
summary: China Development Bank is in talks to buy a minority stake in TPG Holdings, according to a person familiar with the situation, making it the latest major state-backed investor from abroad to seek a piece of the San Francisco-based buyout firm.

headline: Satyam Posts Loss After U.S. Suit
summary: Satyam Computer Services, recovering from India's biggest corporate scandal, fell to a net loss in its fourth quarter, hurt by a one-time charge it took to settle a class-action suit in the U.S.

headline: A Contemporary Inheritance
summary: This Harrison, N.Y., home, which was passed from one generation to the next, has undergone several transformations. This contemporary home has a 3,000-bottle wine cellar, rooms with floor-to-ceiling glass and a tennis court.

headline: RBI Panel Says Holding Company Model Better
summary: A Reserve Bank of India panel on Monday suggested that financial conglomerates should follow a financial holding company structure to enable better regulation.

headline: GAIL India Profit Slips 14%
summary: State-run GAIL (India) said its quarterly profit fell 14% as a higher subsidy burden for government-controlled fuel retailers offset gains from a rise in sales from gas transmission and trading.

headline: MakeMyTrip Announces Proposed Public Offer
summary: The owner of India's largest online travel company, MakeMyTrip.com, and of Luxury Tours & Travel, announced that it plans to sell six million shares to raise fresh funds.

headline: Tata Chemicals Net Rises 8%
summary: India's Tata Chemicals said consolidated net profit for the last fiscal year rose 8% to 6.53 billion rupees ($145.3 million) from 6.06 billion rupees the previous year.

headline: Merrill Lynch Unit Pays to Settle Regulator's Inquiry
summary: India's capital markets regulator said Merrill Lynch Capital Markets Espana had paid 6 million rupees to settle an inquiry into a breach of "know your client" rules.

headline: Par Pharma to Buy India Generic Drug Maker
summary: Par Pharmaceutical will acquire India-based generic drug maker Edict Pharmaceuticals for up to $37.6 million.

headline: India Secretary: To Review Fiscal Goals by 2011 End
summary: India will review its fiscal goals set for the current financial year if global commodity prices remain at elevated levels until 2011-end, the economic affairs secretary said, underscoring rising concerns that Asia's third-largest economy will miss its growth target as prolonged pricing pressures crimp activity.

headline: Japanese Bonds Drift
summary: Japanese government bond yields generally edged higher in directionless trade.

headline: Aurobindo Faces U.S. Scrutiny
summary: Aurobindo Pharma's U.S. regulatory troubles have increased after the country's drug regulator found another one of the company's manufacturing units deficient in meeting its standards.

headline: U.K. Bank Lending Misses Target
summary: Five of the U.K.'s biggest banks agreed to lend U.K. businesses £47.3 billion in the first quarter of 2011, according to Bank of England figures.

headline: Kirloskar Investments Ups Stake in Group Firm

headline: India Shares Close Below 18000
summary: Indian shares fell sharply to a near nine-week low Monday as weak manufacturing data from China, coupled with persistent concerns about the euro zone's debt crisis, sparked a sell-off across Asian and European markets.

headline: Glass-Container Maker Wants to Sell 15% Stake
summary: The Somany family, founders of India's largest glass-container manufacturer, Hindusthan National Glass and Industries, is looking to sell about 7.5% of the company's shares to invest in an "unrelated business."

headline: Steel Authority Board OKs Share Sale
summary: State-run Steel Authority of India's board Monday cleared the prospectus for a follow-on share sale, Chairman C.S Verma said.

headline: Renault Launches Fluence Sedan in India
summary: Renault has introduced the Fluence sedan in India, marking its second entry into this growing market for automobiles and also setting the stage for the introduction of four more passenger vehicles by the end of 2012.

headline: Bharat Heavy Wants India to Divest 5% Stake
summary: Bharat Heavy Electricals has recommended that the government divest 5% of its holding in the company through a follow-on public issue.

headline: Shanghai Shares Lead Asia Lower
summary: Chinese stocks suffered their worst fall in more than four months to lead Asian markets lower, weighed down by weakening manufacturing growth. The Nikkei fell 1.5%.

headline: India May Allow Foreigners to Invest in Mutual Funds
summary: The Indian government may allow foreigners to invest in local mutual funds from July, a senior official said.

headline: Bharat Heavy Seeks Government Stake Sale
summary: India's largest power equipment manufacturer by sales, Bharat Heavy Electricals, recommended the federal government sell a 5% stake in the state-run company through a follow-on public issue, even as it announced its fourth quarter net profit surged 46.5%.

headline: Magma Fincorp to Allot Preferential Shares
summary: Magma Fincorp will raise 4.4 billion rupees by selling a 27.5% stake in the non-banking finance company to two global investors.

headline: Super Religare Withdraws Draft IPO Document
summary: Super Religare Laboratories said it has withdrawn its draft offer document filed with the Indian capital market regulator for an initial share sale, as the medical diagnostics chain operator needs to revise the document to reflect a new ownership pattern.

headline: U.S. Auto Makers Get Improved Marks in Supplier Study
summary: The Big Three auto makers are enjoying improved working relationships with their parts suppliers while their Japanese counterparts face more tension, underscoring the ongoing changing fortunes in the global auto industry.

headline: Taliban Attack Pakistani Naval Base
summary: Taliban fighters storm a naval base in Karachi, killing at least seven people.

headline: Spain Markets Jittery After Vote
summary: Spanish markets reacted negatively after the ruling Socialist Party suffered a heavy defeat in local and regional elections and calls rose for early general elections later this year.

headline: Domestic Funds Seek Japanese Investors
summary: In a challenging environment for fund-raising, domestic private equity firms are tapping a new source of capital — Japanese investors.

headline: Remittances Fuel Philippines Property Boom
summary: With rising inflation and the potential of a real-estate bubble in the Philippines, can the recent growth last? Century Properties' Robbie Antonio thinks so.

headline: A Chat with Genpact's Pramod Bhasin
summary: Pramod Bhasin, who was chief executive of Genpact, the business process outsourcing company spun out of General Electric, stepped down last week and will become non-executive vice chairman of the company.

headline: Cost of Insuring Euro-Zone Debt Rises
summary: The cost of insuring euro-zone sovereign debt against default using credit default swaps rose in early trading as ratings agency actions and political worries re-focused investors' attention on the single currency area's debt crisis.

headline: SEC Asks Wipro to Prove KPMG Independence
summary: Wipro said it has received a notice from the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, asking the company to prove the independence of its financial auditor, KPMG India, failing which the software exporter will have to appoint a new auditor.

headline: Three Asian Giants Study Trade Pact
summary: The leaders of Japan, China and South Korea pledged to speed up preparations for a possible three-way free trade pact.

headline: IPL Roundup
summary: Royal Challengers Bangalore toppled Chennai Super Kings with an eight wicket victory and Mumbai Indians broke their losing streak with a five wicket win over Kolkata Knight Riders.

headline: Week Ahead: Cairn-Vedanta Deal Again
summary: This could be a big week for energy companies Cairn Energy and Vedanta Resources. A ministerial panel, which had put off its prior meetings, is expected to make its fianl verdict on the issue this Friday.

headline: Poor Board, Poor Team
summary: A first-choice West Indies 11 would be a formidable outfit, but no one can remember the last time they fielded one.

headline: The Transformation of a 'Cultural Desert'
summary: Magnus Renfrew, director of Art Hong Kong, shares the moment when he realized Hong Kong's potential in the art world.

headline: The Power List
summary: The top business leaders in Asia making headlines last week in select global and regional media. Powered by Dow Jones Factiva and edited for relevance and clarity.

headline: Yuan Funds May Be More Illusion Than Oasis
summary: Many private-equity funds are convinced that investing in China with the country's own currency will help them crack a market long on promise and short on deals. They may yet face disappointment.

headline: Recruiting in China Gets Harder
summary: As foreign companies increase their presence in China, some are finding that local companies' growing success is making it harder to attract Chinese managers.

headline: Poll Favors Democrat in Special Election
summary: A Democratic congressional candidate has built a slight lead in a traditionally Republican district,  according to a new poll on a special election Tuesday.

headline: Grand Central Apple Store Seed Planted
summary: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority is looking for new tenants for a marquee space in Grand Central Terminal, and computer giant Apple Inc. has expressed interest in putting a store there.

headline: Dear Book Lover: The Allure of Unreliable Narrators
summary: Cynthia Crossen on fictional manipulators.

headline: An NBA Voyage to the Heart of Dirk-Ness
summary: These NBA playoffs give the Dallas Mavericks' Dirk Nowitzki a chance to help settle an argument that has entertained basketball fans: Just how great is he?

headline: The Future of Freight Railroads
summary: Freight railroads have made a strong comeback in recent years. Can they stay on track? Four experts with long involvement in the rail industry offer their opinions.

summary: At last, technology is on the verge of transforming freight rail. The likely outcome: a digital network carrying greater volumes at faster speeds and lower costs.

headline: Baby Found in Trash
summary: Police pulled a newborn baby boy with his umbilical cord still attached out of a trash compactor in a Fort Greene housing project Sunday.

headline: Bronx's Best Take the Walk of Fame
summary: This year's Walk of Fame inductees included Chazz Palminteri, whose one-man show 'A Bronx Tale' was made into a movie; Charles Latibeaudiere, co-executive producer of the celebrity news show TMZ and the former model Joy Bryant, who now stars on the NBC dramedy 'Parenthood.'

headline: Charging Stations Could Use Subscriptions
summary: As electric cars proliferate, the business of recharging them may look less like the filling-station model and more like the way consumers pay for cellphone service.

headline: Turkey Ruling Party Denies Role in Sex-Tape Scandal
summary: Turkey's Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan denied claims that his party was behind a sex-tape scandal that forced six senior members of a key nationalist opposition party to resign just weeks before national elections.

headline: As Natural Gas Prices Fall, Search Turns to Oil
summary: The natural-gas industry touts its fuel as an attractive alternative to coal and oil, saying it's comparably clean, domestically abundant and cheap. But that final selling point might not last if the industry succeeds in stirring demand even as it cuts back on drilling.

headline: Man Held in Fan Attack
summary: Police arrested a man in connection with the beating of a San Francisco Giants fan severely assaulted at Dodger Stadium after an opening-day game between the Giants and the Dodgers.

headline: Jeter a Stolen Base Away From Setting Yankee Record
summary: Derek Jeter is about to become the team's career stolen bases leader. He tied Rickey Henderson for first place Saturday with his 326th steal as a Yankee.

headline: In This Yarn With a Tail, Our Heroes Thirst for Hair of the Dog
summary: Yarn artisans are embracing dog hair, doing everything they can to turn garments knitted of canine sheddings from a pet-owner's fetish into a fashion trend.

headline: EU Boosts Its Ties to Libyan Opposition
summary: The EU was establishing formal diplomatic contacts with the Libyan opposition by opening an office in the rebel stronghold of Benghazi.

headline: Treasurys Gains at Risk
summary: U.S. Treasury yields could rebound from their lows of the year as a wave of corporate bond sales hits the market.

headline: Money for Defense Counts Too Much
summary: The results of the Raj Rajaratnam trial notwithstanding, our treasured judicial system isn't all it's cracked up to be ("Defense Worked—to a Point," Money & Investing, May 18).

headline: New Tools for Picking TV Hits
summary: Advertisers are tapping new types of data, ranging from social-media buzz to economic statistics, to evaluate TV shows.

headline: Trucking With America's Relatively Cheap Natural Gas
summary: Representatives of United Parcel Service Inc. and Republic Services Inc. say that their companies would buy fewer natural-gas trucks if federal subsidies for purchasing the vehicles are curtailed ("Natural-Gas Trucks Face Long Haul" (Marketplace, May 17).

headline: Sea Lions Turn Salmon Run Into Buffet
summary: It's mammal vs. fish in the churning waters of the Columbia River, where California sea lions are pitted against Chinook salmon in a struggle for survival that federal agencies—and now a federal court—must sort out.

headline: O'Grady: Peru's Election: A Vote on Modernity
summary: National-socialist presidential candidate Ollanta Humala could bring the nation's growing, market-led prosperity to a screeching halt.

summary: Hotel investor KSL Capital Partners purchased a luxury resort near Phoenix from the banks that foreclosed on it two years ago, paying a price that underscores the recovery in hotel values.

headline: Gotham Hideout
summary: Tenpenny is the perfect hideaway for an informal meeting with a client or a quiet meal alone.

headline: Labelux Says the Choo Fits
summary: Labelux, a German luxury-goods holding company, agreed to buy the Jimmy Choo shoe company from TowerBrook Capital.

headline: Hopeful Signals Emerge for RIM's PlayBook
summary: After a rocky PlayBook launch last month, there are glimmers of hope for the tablet made by Research in Motion, which has suffered a string of bad news.

headline: Malware Is Posing Increasing Danger
summary: One in every 14 downloads is a piece of malware, according to information released by Microsoft last week. To try to inhibit the growth, antivirus defenses have to attack the problem from other directions.

headline: Panasonic Sees 'Very Tough' Year Ahead
summary: Panasonic President Fumio Ohtsubo said the Japanese electronics giant expects the impact from the March 11 earthquake to continue beyond the current quarter.

headline: Buyers Battle for Europe's Bad Loans
summary: As banks across Europe clean up their polluted balance sheets, it's causing a feeding frenzy among hedge funds and private-equity firms.

headline: Song Composer Awaiting Trial Is Found Dead
summary: Joseph Brooks, the Oscar-winning composer of the ballad "You Light Up My Life" who faced charges of raping aspiring actresses, was found dead from an apparent suicide in his Upper East Side apartment at age 73.

headline: LinkedIn Options to Exercise Investors
summary: Another reason for investors to avoid getting linked up with LinkedIn: the pile of stock options outstanding.

headline: Project Puts Brooklyn First
summary: From its bathroom vanities to its bamboo floors, Atlantic Terrace is steeped in and guided by ideology: more precisely, by the desire to propagate an economically integrated society in rapidly gentrifying Brooklyn.

headline: Study Sees Benefits in Outside Board Seats
summary: CEOs with outside board seats sometimes perform better than those who don't have them, according to a new study.

headline: Rain Aids the Allergy Afflicted
summary: Most New Yorkers grieved as the tantalizing first shoots of spring were drowned out by steady rains and chilly winds. But a subset of New Yorkers, allergy sufferers, got something in return: They're sneezing less.

headline: Dancing Out of the Dark
summary: With his new book, evolutionary neurobiologist Mark Changizi attempts to explain why humans are inclined to shake our collective thing.

headline: Reynolds to Begin New Tobacco Ad Campaign
summary: Tobacco giant Reynolds American is seizing on new antismoking laws in New York City this week to launch an advertising campaign for Camel Snus, a small but growing smokeless brand.

headline: Balls Take Yankee Bounce
summary: Derek Jeter's and Alex Rodriguez's ground-ball singles spark a decisive eight-run rally.

headline: Massachusetts Spread
summary: The owners 11.4-acre property in Wayland, Mass., replaced their existing farmhouse with a 25,400-square-foot home with five bedrooms in 2002. The home has a library, a fitness room, a theater and a billiards room.

headline: They're the Carrying Kind
summary: When choreographer Monica Bill Barnes goes on tour, she does it Vaudeville style.Here's what her company carries on, checks, and ships from one site to the next.

headline: A Disastrous 7th Derails the Mets
summary: The seventh inning was an uncanny combination of managerial maneuvers that didn't pan out, awful luck and, yes, a couple of critical mistakes.

headline: Build America Bonds Should Rest in Peace
summary: The Obama administration keeps trumpeting Build America Bonds. But its arguments aren't in tune with current muni-market conditions or the debate over deficit reduction.

headline: Waking Up to Greece's Default Position
summary: The eurocracy devised a plan for coping with a liquidity crisis when Greece, Portugal and Ireland were facing a solvency crisis. Thankfully, the new diagnosis is closer to reality.

headline: Dell Lowers Sights for Gadgets
summary: Dell will release a slim laptop designed to better compete with Apple's MacBook but the company has pared its consumer ambitions after years of stumbling.
